00074 #include "board.h"
00075 #include "gpio.h"
00076 #include "pm.h"
00077 
00078 
00079 /* Switch to clock Osc0 (crystal) */
00080 static void local_switch_to_osc0(volatile avr32_pm_t* pm)
00081 {
00082   pm_enable_osc0_crystal(pm, FOSC0);  // with Osc
00083   pm_enable_clk0(pm, OSC0_STARTUP);
00084   pm_switch_to_clock(pm, AVR32_PM_MCSEL_OSC0);
00085 }
00086 
00087 
00088 /* Enable GCLK0 output on AVR32_PM_GCLK_0_1_PIN*/
00089 static void local_enable_gclk0_on_gpio(volatile avr32_pm_t* pm)
00090 {
00091   int gc=0; /* gclk 0 is used */
00092 
00093   /* setup gc0 on Osc0, no divisor */
00094   pm_gc_setup(pm, gc, AVR32_GC_USES_OSC, AVR32_GC_USES_OSC0, AVR32_GC_NO_DIV_CLOCK, 0);
00095 
00096   /* Now enable the generic clock */
00097   pm_gc_enable(pm,gc);
00098 
00099   /* Assign a GPIO to generic clock GCLK0 output */
00100   gpio_enable_module_pin(AVR32_PM_GCLK_0_1_PIN, AVR32_PM_GCLK_0_1_FUNCTION);
00101   // Note that gclk0_1 is pin 51 pb19 on AT32UC3A0512 QFP144.
00102 }
00103 
00104 
00105 /* \brief This is an example of how to configure the Power Manager to use Oscillator 0 as main clock
00106  * then configure a generic clock GCLK to be outputed to GLCK_0_1.
00107  *
00108  */
00109 int main(void)
00110 {
00111   volatile avr32_pm_t* pm = &AVR32_PM;
00112   local_switch_to_osc0(pm);
00113   local_enable_gclk0_on_gpio(pm);
00114 
00115   while(1);
00116 }
